results.title: The Dark Knight
results.headline_credit: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2008
results.brief_description: From the opening sequence to the final frame, Christopher Nolan’s The Dark Knight never wastes a moment. Featuring Heath Ledger’s legendary, Oscar-winning performance as the Joker, action-packed set pieces and philosophical musings not seen in superhero movies, The Dark Knight is one of the best.

constellations_other.name: Big screen dreams
constellations_other.description: With groundbreaking technology and a unique cinema experience, today IMAX theatres are not only loved by audiences but championed by pioneering filmmakers like Christopher Nolan and James Cameron. Yet the route to get there was an unconventional one.

constellations_other.name: Oscar-winning transformations and prosthetics
constellations_other.description: This Constellation explores how craft help actors undergo award-winning transformations into iconic characters.

results.headline_credit_for_label: United Kingdom and United States of America, 2008
results.description: Batman raises the stakes in his war on crime. With the help of Lt. Jim Gordon and District Attorney Harvey Dent, Batman sets out to dismantle the remaining criminal organizations that plague the streets. The partnership proves to be effective, but they soon find themselves prey to a reign of chaos unleashed by a rising criminal mastermind known to the terrified citizens of Gotham as the Joker.
description_for_label: Batman raises the stakes in his war on crime. With the help of Lt. results.title: The Dark gate
results.creator_credit: Robert Gordon, David Dortort and National Broadcasting Company
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Bonanza”.
In this episode from Season Two of ‘Bonanza’ (first screened 3/4/61), Adam is puzzled by the bizarre behaviour of his longtime friend and neighbour but is powerless to help him. When Ross becomes physically violent with his wife, Adam removes her from the home to give Ross time to come to his senses. However, Ross’ behavior grows increasingly worse and he progresses to robbery and murder. Cast includes Lorne Greene, Michael Landon, Dan Blocker, Pernell Roberts and James Coburn.

results.title: The Dark crystal
results.creator_credit: Frank Oz, Jim Henson, Gary Kurtz, ITC Entertainment and Henson Associates
results.brief_description: A magnificent puppet animation from the Muppets creator, Jim Henson. The tale begins when Jen is told of a prophecy by his master - a wise and gentle mystic. Jen sets to the task of returning the crystal shard to the all powerful Dark Crystal, making it whole again, and restoring light to the world. For the first time ever, here is a totally live action film inhabited only by creatures - set in another world, another time - in the age of wonder. Rated: G

results.title: The Darien conquest
results.brief_description: Combining a sense of adventure and a touch of wit this film is a record of the successful British Trans-Americas Expedition, led by Major Blashford-Snell, through the Darien Gap. It shows the terrible conditions that the men had to go through to achieve this success and also displays the versatility of the two Range-Rover vehicles used.

results.title: The Danube
results.creator_credit: D.C. Chipperfield, Educational Foundation for Visual Aids and Boulton-Hawker Films
results.brief_description: Follows the course of the Danube through Southern Central Europe from the Black Forest to the Black Sea. Depicts the farming activities of the peoples of the region and their cultural background, the variety of the landscape, the main towns, the traffic and the development of navigation and hydro-electric power along its course. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: The Danish village church
results.creator_credit: Preben Frank Film and Dansk Kulturfilm
results.brief_description: A history of Danish village churches and their architecture. The first churches were built of wood, but none survive in Denmark. In the 12th century stone was used; buildings were in a simple Romanesque style. Frescoes, telling Bible stories or legends of saints were used to decorate the interiors. In the 13th century bigger, more elaborate churches appeared in Gothic styles. Brick was used as a building material, particularly for additions to earlier churches. Changes at the reformation were not violent; seats became more common, since sermons were longer. Churches remain a centre of secular as well as religious life for peasants. Architectural history is briefly summarised. Supervised by Carl Th. Dreyer, Victor Herman, Bernhard Jensen, H. Longborg-Jensen.

results.title: The Dangerous years
results.creator_credit: William T. Cartwright and Bud Wiser
results.brief_description: Examines the juvenile crime dilemma facing society today. Through actual on-the-spot scenes, this film reveals the world of the juvenile offender and the often frustrated efforts of the police to stem the tide of juvenile crime.
results.description: Examines the juvenile crime dilemma facing society today. Through actual on-the-spot scenes, this film reveals the world of the juvenile offender and the often frustrated efforts of the police to stem the tide of juvenile crime.

results.title: The Dangerous stranger [B&W]
results.creator_credit: Sid Davis and Sid Davis Productions
results.brief_description: Produced with the assistance of the Los Angeles Police Department. Designed to impress children with the need to be on guard against molesters. Dramatizes places and circumstances under which the child may encounter dangerous strangers under unsupervised conditions and indicates how to avoid potential molesters. Human interest, common sense and humour are used, but fear is scrupulously avoided. Written and photographed by Orville H. Hampton. All the perverts in this film wear sport jackets.

results.title: The Dandenong Story
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson and Cine Service Productions
results.brief_description: Dandenong, Victoria, named after an Aboriginal tribe, is a fast growing town. As the gateway to Gippsland and the Latrobe Valley, it is important for agriculture. But even more significant is the development of big industrial plants manufacturing goods such as carpets, trucks, cars and fruit cans. Such decentralization of industry is bringing prosperity and a high standard of living to Dandenong and Australia as a whole.
